ack.title: Acknowledgments
ack.p: We thank the following researchers, who greatly assisted our study: Mpoudi Ngole Eitel, Jim Gockowski, Pia K. Muchaal, Christian Nolte, A. Tassy Prosser, Lisa M. Schloegel, Judith Ndongo Torimiro, and Stephan F. Weise. We thank the staff of the Walter Reed Johns Hopkins Cameroon program for assistance with fieldwork and specimen processing, the government of Cameroon for permission to undertake the study, and the US Embassy, Yaound√© for their support.

The V. Kann Rasmussen Foundation provided core support to the Consortium for Conservation Medicine. Peter Daszak is supported by a National Institutes of Health (NIH)/National Science Foundation "Ecology of Infectious Diseases" award from the John E. Fogarty International Center of NIH, R01 TW05869. A. Marm Kilpatrick is supported by NIAID contract #14-0131 and a grant from the Wilburforce Foundation. Work in Cameroon is funded by the Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health Center for a Livable Future, the National Institutes of Health (NIH) Fogarty International Center (K01 TW000003-05), the National Geographic Society Committee for Research and Exploration, and Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health, Center for AIDS Research (NIH P30 AI42855). This work was supported in part by a grant to Dr Burke from the US Military HIV Research Program. Dr Wolfe is supported by the NIH Director's Pioneer Award Program (DP1-OD000370).
